overview: When in 1998 Chilean judge Juan Guzm치n was assigned the first criminal cases against the country's ex-dictator, General Augusto Pinochet, no one expected much. Guzm치n had supported Pinochet's 1973 coup against the democratically elected president, Salvador Allende, and had worked as a judge during Pinochet's dictatorship. The filmmakers trace Guzm치n descent into what he calls "the abyss," where he uncovers the past - including his own role in the tragedy
title: The Judge and the General
